TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void RoleManagerEventHandler(object sender, RoleManagerEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed RoleManagerEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub RoleManagerEventHandler(sender As Object, e As RoleManagerEventArgs)
public delegate void RoleManagerEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, RoleManagerEventArgs ^ e);
type RoleManagerEventHandler = delegate of obj * RoleManagerEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Defines the delegate for the event of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerEventHandler> delegate is defined for the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule> class. You can access the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule> class in the Global.asax file for your ASP.NET application as shown in the example for this topic.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerEventHandler> to replace the creation of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RolePrincipal> object by the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule> with your own custom object. To do this, define a delegate using the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerEventHandler> and assign it to the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule>.
## Examples The following example shows the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event included in the Global.asax file for an ASP.NET application. The <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event adds a trace notification for an application where trace is enabled in the Web.config file.
